Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Kneeling naophorous statuette
Description: This piece shows a kneeling man presenting a naos. The whole is very rudimentary: the head is a simple square block without indication of facial features and the naos, worked in the form of a rectangular block, forms a whole with the body and the arms of the person. At the front of the statuette, one notices an unfinished dorsal pillar.
